name: Pavan Kumar Bellam
title: AI Engineer
tagline: Building production ML systems that actually work
about: MS in Artificial Intelligence from RIT. I've spent years building production ML systems — from recommendation engines and computer vision pipelines to LLM-powered applications.
My philosophy is simple: a model that only works in a Jupyter notebook is just an expensive experiment. I build systems that scale, handle edge cases, and work when the data gets messy.

highlights.description: Built NLP demo platform with SHAP/LIME interpretability; deployed via Docker on in-house servers
Developed two-stage VAE for RF signal fault detection, 93% F1 at 0.2% signal deviation

highlights: Developed an NLP model demonstration platform with Angular frontend and microservices backend (Tornado for ML, Node.js for API) achieving 920ms average response time
Integrated SHAP and LIME for model interpretability across PyTorch, TensorFlow, and Hugging Face frameworks
Designed a two-stage VAE for fault detection in RF Generator signal data using Gaussian and GMM priors
Achieved an F1-score of 93% with sensitivity of 0.2 at 95% confidence
Performed exploratory data analysis on biometric data: distribution analysis, outlier detection, and preprocessing
Engineered features via time and frequency domain analysis (PSD, peak detection, slope extraction) for resonance frequency identification
Built Streamlit dashboard with Plotly for multi-subject comparison and automated PDF report generation
Reduced student churn by 17% by building a dropout prediction model (XGBoost, 0.82 F1) and integrating risk scores into automated outreach workflows
Built a collaborative filtering course recommender achieving 78% Precision@10, increasing average course enrollments by 15%
Architected cloud infrastructure with Terraform and automated CI/CD via GitHub Actions, cutting release cycles from 2–3 hours to under 10 minutes
Trained R2U-Net model for tubule detection in whole-slide pathology images, achieving 93% IoU at 17× magnification
Deployed inference via FastAPI with confidence scoring on Tesla DGX, enabling slide analysis in under 90 minutes per slide
Built pipelines using QuPath and Groovy to transform 1.5TB+ of annotated whole-slide images into training-ready datasets

projects.name: CiteMate
projects.description: Real-time research writing assistant using a hierarchical multi-agent system that corrects grammar, discovers supporting and opposing literature, and answers questions with citations.
highlights: Scored 9.0/10 vs GPT-5 (4.0/10) on LLM-as-judge evaluation with 24% lower latency
Deployed on AWS using Terraform IaC and GitHub Actions CI/CD with Langtrace observability

projects.name: ScoutIR
projects.description: RAG-based academic paper search engine across 2K+ indexed papers using dense embeddings, BM25 sparse vectors, and Cohere reranking.
highlights: Achieved 93% Hit@5 on a custom 303-query benchmark
Engineered ingestion pipeline with SQS, S3, Redis batching, indexing 80K chunks into Pinecone

projects.name: SmolRL
projects.description: Trained a 7B language model for mathematical reasoning using GRPO reinforcement learning, with test-time compute scaling.
highlights: Improved GSM8K from 78% → 90% and MATH-500 from 58% → 72%
Test-time scaling pushed to 80% MATH-500 and 94% GSM8K
3× throughput via vLLM with <1% accuracy drop after quantization

projects.name: Text-to-SQL
projects.description: Trained Qwen2.5-Coder-7B with LoRA on 2.5M samples to convert natural language questions into SQL using chain-of-thought reasoning.
highlights: Scaled training across 8×A100 GPUs with DeepSpeed ZeRO-2
Fault-tolerant S3 checkpointing for spot instance recovery
Sub-400ms inference via vLLM with prefix caching
